alert.note: Alert for Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 08 at 12:52AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Colorado and west central Kansas, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Kit Carson. In west central Kansas, Wallace. * WHEN...Until 300 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1151 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain may have already fallen. - Secondary roadways will be impacted. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sharon Springs, Weskan and Wallace. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
